body_html:
I have a similar issue, installed patch in MSYS (64) in Windows with pacman -Syuu --noconfirm patch but fails. I can use patch --help from MSYS shell (C:...\msys64\msys2_shell.cmd -mingw64) but the command based on the BAZEL_SH env variable (C:\msys64\usr\bin\bash.exe -c patch --help) doesn't work.

However, if in the cmd I run the bash.exe (enters bash) and then bash (actually starts the MINGW64 shell) then I see patch (and all other stuff) available.

However, if in the cmd I run the bash.exe (enters bash) and then bash (actually starts the MINGW64 shell) then I see patch (and all other stuff) available.
body:
I have a similar issue, installed patch in MSYS (64) in Windows with `pacman -Syuu --noconfirm patch` but fails. I can use `patch --help` from MSYS shell (C:...\msys64\msys2_shell.cmd -mingw64) but the command based on the BAZEL_SH env variable (`C:\msys64\usr\bin\bash.exe -c patch --help`) doesn't work.

However, if in the cmd I run the bash.exe (enters bash) and then bash (actually starts the MINGW64 shell) then I see patch (and all other stuff) available.
